availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Zachariah Walls (Mercer County, Ky, day laborer and pvt 9th Ky Cav USA)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, day laborer and soldier. Casey County, Kentucky, native. Son of George Whitfield Walls and Mary Laura Martin Walls. Married to Malinda Mason Walls on November 18, 1845. Father of Martha "Patsy" Jane Walls, Mary Margaret Walls, Eliza Ann Walls, Lucy Katherine Walls, Baker Walls, Sarah Ellen Walls, and John J. Walls. Day laborer in Mercer County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 9th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment as a private from August 22, 1862, to September 11, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, p. 108.
“Family Honors Civl War Veteran,” The Advocate-Messenger (Danville, Ky.), Nov. 3, 1996, p. 22.
Find A Grave, "Zachariah Walls (unknown-1894)," Memorial #29940864, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/29940864/zachariah-walls (accessed July 9, 2021).
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 246.
